author: draganrakita
content: Aren't verkle going to break a lot of contracts that depend on setting `gas_limit` on any `CALL`s as gas accounting is very different for bytecode execution? Is analysis on this done by anyone?

author: bridge-bot
content: <asqyzeron> if they use the old gas model, they will break for sure, but it's no different than any other previous change to the gas schedule.

author: bridge-bot
content: <asqyzeron> it's up to the tx sender to check that they have enough gas for their tx to complete

author: bridge-bot
content: <asqyzeron> as for the analysis, we are currently working on that, it will take a few more weeks to share the results. This being said, replaying old transactions can only take you so far: it will just tell you by how much the gas costs will increase, not how many contracts fail - obviously, historical txs that were sent, were sent to be compatible with the gas schedule at the time

author: bridge-bot
content: <asqyzeron> ah ok you mean the call cost, yeah, if they hardcode it, they will have to redeploy for sure

author: _shemnon
content: This is why "remove gas introspection" is on the EOF feature list.  EOF calls can't do that so the answer to gas issues can be "send more gas"

author: bridge-bot
content: <asqyzeron> that doesn't matter, unfortunately, as long as there will be legacy contracts

author: _shemnon
content: May need to consider a mechanism like 2930, or extend it to cover that case.
